meanings.sent1: She often lazes around on the weekends, not wanting to do anything.
meanings.sent2: He lazes in the sun, enjoying the warmth on his skin.
meanings.sent3: The cat lazes on the windowsill, watching the world go by.
meanings.sent4: Time lazes by on a lazy summer afternoon, as if in no hurry.
meanings.sent5: The sloth lazes in the tree, moving slowly and peacefully.

meanings.definition: To spend time in a relaxed or lazy way.
meanings.sent1: On vacation, they laze by the pool, soaking up the sun.
meanings.sent2: The old dog lazes in the shade, taking a nap.
meanings.sent3: The river lazily lazes through the valley, meandering gently.
meanings.sent4: The clouds laze across the sky, drifting aimlessly.
meanings.sent5: She lazes on the hammock, swaying gently in the breeze.
